background: Redd counts in large rivers can help to describe the spatial distribution ofspawning salmon. Increases in the spatial distribution of redds can suggest that the a given population/ESU is responding positively to implemented actions. Long-termredd- count datacan also inform the spatial criteria for recoveryestablished recovery plans as well as provide important data for modeling efforts identified suchplans.
title: Counting Salmon Redds in Large Rivers
assumptions:
(1) Our frame represents our target population.

(2) Every redd in shallow water is counted

(3) Every redd at a deep water site selected for sampling is counted
